message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.MA

The paper discusses the Thompson sampling algorithm and its application in various decision-making problems, including bandit problems, dynamic pricing, recommendation, active learning with neural networks, and reinforcement learning in Markov decision processes. These problems are all related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, which suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. The algorithm also involves sequential decision-making and balancing between exploration and exploitation, which are common themes in decision-making problems, suggesting that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the efficiency and effectiveness of the algorithm, which suggests that cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) may also be a relevant sub-category.
